repo.name: kuto
repo.description: Faster updates for big JS projects

readme.summary: The README explains the innovative concept well but lacks complete installation instructions, comprehensive examples, and troubleshooting guidance for production use.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section exists despite this being a complex build tool that transforms code in non-standard ways, and the 'Best Practice' section is vague (references a local script users don't have access to).

injection_risks.description: The `loadAndMaybeTransform` function is called with user-controlled input (`p`) which may lead to code injection vulnerabilities if not properly sanitized.
The `fs.mkdirSync` function is called with user-controlled input (`dist`) which may lead to directory traversal attacks if not properly validated.

critical_findings: Potential code injection vulnerabilities in the `loadAndMaybeTransform` function
Directory traversal attacks possible due to lack of input validation in the `fs.mkdirSync` call
security.summary: The kuto package has some security concerns, including potential code injection vulnerabilities and directory traversal attacks, but overall its security score is moderate.

common_complaints: JavaScript compatibility issues (this binding, dynamic imports)
Installation and setup problems (missing dependencies, syntax errors)
praise_themes: Project discovered through reputable channels (This Week in React newsletter)
sentiment.summary: Kuto shows mixed health with moderate maintainer engagement, technical compatibility issues spanning JS semantics and bundler support, and some users experiencing setup friction, but no clear abandonment signals.

communication.summary: The maintainer provides useful information and is patient, though there could be more technical depth in some responses.

concerns: No closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
3 open issues with no resolution activity
Last commit was over 5 months ago (August 2024)
maintenance.summary: The kuto package shows no maintenance activity for over 6 months with unresolved issues and no contributor engagement, indicating an abandoned project.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and provides a good understanding of the package's functionality, but lacks clear installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: No commits in the past six months
Open issues and no recent activity
Docs: Lack of clear installation instructions and troubleshooting section
Security: Potential code injection vulnerabilities in the `loadAndMaybeTransform` function
Security: Directory traversal attacks possible due to lack of input validation in the `fs.mkdirSync` call
High bus factor risk (100% from top contributor)
highlights: One contributor active in the past six months
